quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: 1970s and Actor
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, mascot. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following groups did NOT have their own television variety show in the 1970s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Village People

questions.question: On May 19, 1997, Sex and the City star Sarah Jessica Parker married this actor, who is famous for the role of Ferris Bueller.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mathew Broderick

questions.question: Which singer had a #1 single in 1995 with the smash hit Kiss From a Rose?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seal

questions.question: This Cheers waitress married Daniel Michael Devito in 1982.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhea Perlman

questions.question: Which actor was married from 1991 to 2001 to Kate and Leopold star Meg Ryan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dennis Quaid

questions.question: This singer, born in Trinidad and Tobago, had a #1 hit in 1984 with Caribbean Queen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Ocean

questions.question: This actress, best known for portraying Buffy the Vampire Slayer, married actor Freddie Prinze Jr. in September 2002.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Michelle Gellar

questions.question: Is it true that Lisa Marie Presley, daughter of Elvis, was once married to actor Nicholas Cage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: The 1975 hit song Love Will Keep Us Together by Captain and Tennille was originally written and recorded in the 1960s by what artist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neil Sedaka

questions.question: This actress, who got her first big break when she was cast in the Bruce Springsteen video Dancing in the Dark, married actor David Arquette in 1999.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Courtney Cox

questions.question: What was the mascot for Orange Julius, a franchise marketing a drink which was a blend of a dairy creamer and oranges, in the 1970s until Arizona State University threatened a lawsuit for stealing their mascot?

options.text: A Native American with a tomahawk

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A devil with a pitchfork

questions.question: CB radios were highly popular during the 1970s, and users (primarily truckers) had a colorful CB slang. A Kojak with a Kodak is a law officer with a radar gun. What is a smokey in a plain brown wrapper?

options.text: A driver who appears to be drunk or is driving recklessly

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An unmarked police car

questions.question: Which singer had a #1 song in 1990 with Nothing Compares 2 U?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sinead O Connor

questions.question: The lyrics of the 1970s hit song Escape (The Piña Colada Song) by Rupert Holmes, describe a plan of two people disenchanted with their current partners to meet for the first time at a bar. What is the name of the bar?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: OMalleys

questions.question: Which artist sang the Oscar-winning theme song of the 1972 movie The Poseidon Adventure?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maureen McGovern

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Howard Stern and Year
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, melvin, beat. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who had a #1 song in 1989 with a remake of Harold Melvin And The Bluenotes hit If You Dont Know Me By Now?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Simply Red

questions.question: What did Howard Sterns father, Ben do for a living?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Radio engineer

questions.question: Name the members of the Dream Team of NBCs flagship AM radio station, WNBC in 1983?

options.text: Howard Stern, Sid Caesar, Don Imus, Soupy Sales
Don Imus, Sid Caesar, Wolfman Jack, Howard Stern
Don Imus, Jay Thomas, Howard Stern, Soupy Sales
Howard Stern, Wolfman Jack, Don Imus, Soupy Sales

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Howard Stern, Wolfman Jack, Don Imus, Soupy Sales

questions.question: Who had a #1 single in 1988 with Foolish Beat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Debbie Gibson

questions.question: Which Swedish duo had a #1 single in 1989 with Listen to Your Heart?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roxette

questions.question: Which group had a # 1 hit in 1990 with (Cant Live Without Your) Love And Affection?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nelson

questions.question: What is the name of Howard Sterns mother, who as Stern often joked, ran her house with the intensity of Hitler?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rae

questions.question: After graduation, Howard Stern worked for what obscure station in Briarcliff Manor, New York, playing disco music?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 107.1 WRNW-FM

questions.question: What is the last name of Howard Sterns chauffeur and security guard, nicknamed Ronnie the midget?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mund

questions.question: What year was self-proclaimed King of All Media, Howard Stern born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1954

questions.question: Who had a #1 hit in 1988 with the massive single Dont Worry, Be Happy, featured in the movie Cocktail?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bobby McFerrin

questions.question: What year did Howard Sterns autobiographical book, Private Parts, hit the shelves?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1993

questions.question: This group, formed by brothers Attrell and Jarrett Cordes, had a #1 hit in 1991 with the single Set Adrift on Memory Bliss?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: P.M Dawn

questions.question: What year did entertainer, Howard Stern receive his Bachelors degree in communications from Boston University?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1976

questions.question: This singer, famous for composing Arthurs Theme (Best That You Can Do), had a #1 hit in 1980 with the massive single Sailing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christopher Cross

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: U.s. and Song
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, actor, aids. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: As AIDS became widely spread, commercials of these appeared for the first time on TV.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Condoms

questions.question: Even though the first system of this kind, Aspen Movie Map was created in 1977, the term did not get coined till 1989.  Lanier, who coined the term,  is one of the pioneers of the field, founding a company, which built some of the first systems in the 1980s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virtual Reality

questions.question: The acronym we now use for this disease was first coined in 1982. Initially referred to as the gay plague, this infectious disease killed 853 people that same year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: AIDS

questions.question: What 1998 song was a #1 hit in the U.S. for Will Smith?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gettin Jiggy Wit It

questions.question: The true cowboy in the comedy City Slickers, this man was an actor who professed to enjoy acting in westerns.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Palance

questions.question: Which comic actor starred with Shelley Winters in the Poseidon Adventure and was famed on the Dean Martin Roast programs for his skit on Never Got a Dinner?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Buttons

questions.question: Model 5150 of this was announced in 1981 by IBM and retailed for $2880.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: PC

questions.question: The launch of this item is referred to as the Big Bang of digital audio revolution. It was released on the market in 1983 and 800,000 were sold in the US alone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Compact Disc

questions.question: The first reports about this surfaced in 1984, when a group of British scientists discovered  a 35% reduction, in comparison to 1960.  Later, the American satellite Nimbus-7 confirmed the statements. What was discovered?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ozone Hole

questions.question: Tim Berners-Lee was the creator of this, initially a networked information project at CERN.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The World Wide Web

questions.question: This song was a #1 hit in the U.S. for Wilson Phillips in 1990.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hold On

questions.question: This accident occurred in 1986 when a reactor in a Ukrainian nuclear power plant exploded. As a result, at least 5% of the radioactive material  in the reactor core leaked into the atmosphere.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Chernobyl Accident

questions.question: This song by Bryan Adams was a #1 hit in the U.S. in 1995.

options.text: (Everything I Do ) I Do It for You
Have You Ever Really  Loved A Woman

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Have You Ever Really  Loved A Woman

questions.question: In November 9, 1989 this symbol of communism fell, after 28 years in existence.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Berlin Wall

questions.question: The war was caused by Saddam Husseins aspirations to Iran.  It began on 22 September 1980 on the pretext that Iran backed an assassination attempt against Iraqs Foreign Minister, Tariq Aziz.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The First Persian Gulf War

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Kevin Bacon
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, doubt, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This song came off the The Bodyguard soundtrack and was a #1 hit for Whitney Houston in 1992.

options.text: The Closer I Get To You

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Will Always Love You

questions.question: In this 1999 movie, Kevin Bacons character is hypnotized and begins to have visions of a young girl being brutally attacked and then begins to see her ghost. He becomes obsessed with finding out the truth of what happened. In doing so, he puts his life in danger because those around him are trying to keep their own secrets buried.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stir of Echoes

questions.question: This 1984 movie stars Kevin Bacon as a teenager who moves to a small town that doesnt allow rock music or dancing. After befriending a group of students, they make it their mission to have a senior prom.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Footloose

questions.question: This song by Cher was a huge smash hit in 1999 and skyrocketed all the way to #1.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Believe

questions.question: This 1991 romantic comedy stars Kevin Bacon and Elizabeth Perkins as rival journalists who eventually discover they have feelings for each other.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He Said, She Said

questions.question: This song was a #1 hit for No Doubt in the U.S. in 1996.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dont Speak

questions.question: What song recorded by T.L.C.  was a #1 hit in the U.S. in 1995?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waterfalls

questions.question: Kevin Bacon stars in this 2000 movie as a brilliant scientist who is developing an invisibility serum for the military. He decides to test the serum on himself and when he is unable to regain his visibility, he becomes violent and begins to kill off everyone who knows about his secret.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hollow Man

questions.question: This smash hit performed by Toni Braxton was a #1 song in the U.S. in 1996.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Unbreak My Heart

questions.question: Which song was a huge hit for singer Vanilla Ice in 1990?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ice Ice Baby

questions.question: What classic 90s song was a smash hit in 1992 for rapper Sir-Mix-Alot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baby Got Back

questions.question: This 2005 movie stars Kevin Bacon as a stuck up hairdresser named Jorge.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beauty Shop

questions.question: This 2004 movie stars Kevin Bacon who portrays a pedophile returning home after being imprisoned for 12 years. He finds himself abandoned  by friends and family, then he meets Vicki, a love interest played by real life wife Kyra Sedgwick.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Woodsman

questions.question: This 2002 movie stars Kevin Bacon and Courtney Love, who plays his wife and partner in crime in the abductions of children from wealthy families for ransom rewards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trapped

questions.question: This 2005 movie, set in the late 50s, stars Kevin Bacon and Colin Firth as a Martin and Lewis-like comedy team who fall apart after a young woman is found dead in their hotel room.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Where the Truth Lies

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Disney and Kevin Bacon
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, stars, abu. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In this 1997 film Kevin Bacon plays an egotistical co-worker who becomes interested in Jennifer Anistons character Kate, only after he believes that she is involved with somebody else.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Picture Perfect

questions.question: This 1992 film with an all-star cast which included Kevin Bacon, won numerous categories at both the Academy Awards and the Golden Globe Awards and was also critically acclaimed on Broadway.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Few Good Men

questions.question: Olympian Gods Hera, Zeus and Hades share the screen with mortal Meg in what Disney animated movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hercules

questions.question: Tiger Lilly, the lost boys and the Darling children all collide in which Disney movie?

options.text: The Adventures of Icabod and Mr. Toad

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter Pan

questions.question: Kyra Sedgwick, the real-life wife of Kevin Bacon, plays a hooker in this 1995 film also starring Christian Slater.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Murder in the First

questions.question: Dr. Jumba Jookiba, Mrs. Hasagawa and Pleakley are characters in which Disney cartoon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lilo  Stitch

questions.question: The daughters from this Disney movie are named: Adella, Alana, Andrina, Aquatta, Ariel, Arista, and Attina.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The little Mermaid

questions.question: Kala, Jane Porter and Clayton are characters from which Disney feature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tarzan

questions.question: This 1994 movie stars Kevin Bacon and Meryl Streep, who plays an expert rafter on an excursion with her family. They come across two fugitives who try to escape authorities and need to be led down the rapids.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The River Wild

questions.question: Abu, Rajah and Jafar are from what Disney movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aladdin

questions.question: Taking place in Hells Kitchen, this 1996 film is about 4 childhood friends who get sent away to an all-boys juvenile detention center after a prank goes tragically wrong.  While there, they are physically and sexually assaulted by the guards, one of whom is played by Kevin Bacon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sleepers

questions.question: Which Disney movie has characters named Pongo, Perdy, Lucky and Lucy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 101 Dalmatians

questions.question: Stromboli, Gideon and Figaro are characters in which Disney movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pinocchio

questions.question: Which Disney movie are the characters Drizella, Lucifer, Anastasia and Octavius from?

options.text: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cinderella

questions.question: Bagheera, Shere Kahn, and Baloo are from what Disney movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Jungle Book

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and Film
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, nala. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This 2000 John Travolta sci-fi movie has been described as Travolting. Heavily hyped by the Church of Scientology, it is regarded as one of the great box office failures. By its sixth weekend, the film was showing at only 95 theaters and was making less than $200 per theater.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battlefield Earth

questions.question: Li Shang falls in love with the title character from this 1998 Disney movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mulan

questions.question: Movies this bad should be handled with Teflon gloves and a pair of tongs. This is what was said at the DVD Talk website on the film Leonard Part 6.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Cosby

questions.question: 1982 was a good year for country music.  Kenny Rogers movie Six Pack was in the theaters, and songs like Mountain Music by Alabama, Always on my Mind by Willie Nelson, and Any Day Now by this artist were selling a lot of records.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronnie Milsap

questions.question: Listen to the clip and name this singer performing the song Heart to Heart from the 1982 album High Adventure.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kenny Loggins

questions.question: The Wicked Queen Grimhilde and the huntsman Hubert try to kill the princess in this Disney Classic.

options.text: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

questions.question: Sarabi, Nala, and Zazu are character names in which Disney movie?

options.text: The Adventures of Alice in Wonderland

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lion King

questions.question: This literary terms refers to a contrast between expectation and reality or discordance between acts and results.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: irony

questions.question: Gaston tries to woo the title character from which Disney movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beauty and the Beast

questions.question: Pain and Panic are the henchman of a Disney villain in what movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hercules

questions.question: Name the song (in the sound clip) by the band Journey that initiated thousands of slow dances and couple skates across the U.S. in 1982.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Open Arms

questions.question: This is the attitude writers take toward their subject, characters, and audience.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: tone

questions.question: This is an exaggerated, far-fetched story that is obviously untrue, but is told as though it should be believed.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: tall tale

questions.question: This is the use of clues or hints to suggest events that will occur later in the plot.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: foreshadowing

questions.question: This is the point in a story that creates the greatest suspense or interest.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: climax
